page.title: 08GEOGRAPHY AND ENVIRONMENT
page.content: Most of the area has a rural appear- ance being dominated by farmland. The only built up area of any significance is Burbage, with the smaller villages of Aston Flamville and Sharnford. The farms are of a mixed variety, chiefly growing wheat,barley and root crops.Most of the cattle are of the Freisian breed.Most fields are divided by hedgerows.On much of the farmland, grass is an intensively cultivated crop.This is used for pasture and for cutting as silage or hay. Burbage is now a suburb of Hinckley, having rapidly expanded its housing stock in the last 20 years.Most of the houses are private semi-detached and detached dwellings. Industry has had a minimal impact on the environment.The M69 Motorway has reduced traffic in Sharnford.
